alert.note: Alert for Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 29 at 2:39PM EDT until July 29 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northern New York, including the following county, Essex. Portions of central Vermont, including the following county, Addison. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 239 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 0.75 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.25 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Middlebury, Crown Point, Cornwall, Weybridge, Bridport, Whiting, New Haven, Salisbury, Shoreham, Addison, Bristol, D A R State Park, Ripton, Lincoln, West Cornwall, Hollands Pasture Island, Brooksville, West Salisbury, East Middlebury and West Bridport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
